title: Turner Syndrome: Epidemiology and Diagnosis
short_description: Clinical overview of Turner syndrome prevalence, affecting 1 in 2,000-2,500 female births with variable diagnostic timing.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological information about Turner syndrome, a genetic disorder affecting females. It details the prevalence rate of approximately 1 in 2,000-2,500 live female births, with an estimated 70,000+ affected women and girls in the United States. The document emphasizes that the condition shows no racial or ethnic predisposition and discusses the variable timing of diagnosis, ranging from prenatal or neonatal detection to delayed diagnosis in adulthood, particularly in milder cases.
